title: Megan McKenna admits she regrets 'awful' plastic surgery and huge lips
text:

Megan McKenna's fans have come out in force to sing her praises on social media after the X Factor star admitted she regrets her lip fillers and chatted about her past struggles with body image.

The former Towie cast member chatted with Christine Lampard, filling in for Lorraine Kelly, about her music, her hard-partying past and the difficulties of body dysmorphia.

She's often been candid and open about the topic, recently telling The Sun that she became "obsessed" with her lips in her pursuit of what she considered the right look.

Speaking with Christine, Megan agreed with the host that her story and how she turned her life around could have a positive impact on young girls.

(Image: ITV)

(Image: ITV)

The 27-year-old said: "What I would like to say to my younger self is you really need to accept the way you look.

"I know there's Instagram and looking online and wanting to look like other people and I was doing that massively. You lose yourself a bit and you forget...I feel like I looked awful."

Megan recalled times her mum would tell her her lips looked too big, and said that the attention she received for them made her feel worse.

She revealed: "All the stories written about me was about my big lips. It really as I've been working so hard with my music."

Fans were quick to get behind their keyboards and tweet about the reality star-singer's fresh-faced beauty.

(Image: ITV)

(Image: Getty Images)

One wrote: "@Megan_Mckenna_ you are so beautiful and look so natural. Can't wait to see you perform this weekend. Good luck. X #teammegan."

Another gushed: "Love how smiley @Megan_Mckenna_ is! She's so beautiful."

A third penned: "Awww @Megan_Mckenna_ you are looking so naturally stunning right now &your song on the X Factor was amazing #keepgoing."

A fourth fancied Megan's chances in the singing contest: "#lorraine Absolutely love @Megan_Mckenna_ She'll go all the way to the winning post @lorraine."

After a tough year, X Factor means a huge amount to Megan.

Back in March, she was blindsided by the suicide of ex-boyfriend Mike Thalassitis - he was found hanged in a park in North London.

Megan wrote: "Sorry I haven't been on social media but I'm in complete shock and trying to come to terms with this. I can't believe I'm even writing this post. My thoughts and prayers are with Mike's family. Rest in peace Mike."

Megan will be back on telly screens at the weekend for the first of the X Factor live shows - many fans reckon she's in with a solid chance of taking home the gold.
description: Megan told Christine Lampard that she's struggled with her body image in the past as fans took to social media to gush over how good she looks
